alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Laramie Valley; North Laramie Range; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Snowy Range; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 4:41AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A thunderstorm with gusty winds will impact portions of southeastern Carbon and Albany Counties through 545 AM MDT... At 440 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rock River, or 28 miles northwest of Laramie, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Laramie, Albany, Saratoga, Hanna, Medicine Bow, Rock River, Elk Mountain, Bosler, Tie Siding, Brooklyn Lake Campground, Pumpkin Vine, Vedauwoo Campground, Nash Fork Campground, Ryan Park Campground, The Buttes, Hutton Lake, Arlington, Yellow Pine Campground, Tie City Campground and Vedauwoo. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 237 and 336. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
